refsect2.title: What and Why?
refsect2.para: Whilst enormously handy, GLib's testing framework can be somewhat cumbersome:

itemizedlist.listitem: Building test suites with GTestCase involves a lot of boilerplate, which can be particularly frustrating if most of your tests don't require complicated fixtures.
Test cases are required to use a separate (less flexible) asserts API, as g_assert() and g_assert_not_reached() always abort the program regardless of g_test_set_nonfatal_assertions() .
Test cases are required to check the results of assertions and explicitly return on failure, making it easy to write buggy tests by mistake.

refsect2.para: Given that the testing framework is part of GLib proper and is designed to be reasonably flexible, these are understandable issues to have; in many testing-specific scenarios, however, it may be preferable to trade in some flexibility and correctness for added convenience.
GTU aims to fill this gap: without the burden of being a general-purpose batteries-included library, we can use mechanisms that might otherwise be considered uncouth to make things simpler.

refsect2.title: The What Test Utilities?
refsect2.para: 'GTU' is an abbreviation for 'Gii Test Utilities'. 'Gii' is pronounced just like 'Gee' (the name from which it's derived); the only connection between GTU and another GLib-based utility library is a common cute name.
